descendants.content:
@chad

Damn.

Hope they manage to protect the town. I know they’ve been doing a lot, from prescribed burning to firebreaks, over the past 25 years or so.

But the last couple times I’ve been there (2018, 2023) the amount of dead standing timber from pine beetle etc made me feel nervous.

account.note:
small axe working for sustained / systemic change (he / him).

Also Senior Lecturer, TD School at UTS.

descendants.content: @scottmatter it's tough. I know they're doing everything they can to protect life and property. It's now a mutual aid fire between Parks Canada and Alberta Wildfire.

descendants.content:
@chad

Such a special place for so many people. I know fire’s part of the ecosystem (with a very complicated history of dispossession, fire suppression, and adaptive management), but it hurts to see a big one like this.

Fwiw, this amazing project is relevant to this situation: https://mountainlegacy.ca/about/

fields.name: Intermittent blogging
fields.value: https://www.scottmatter.org/blog/

descendants.content:
@scottmatter it's a very special place. I would argue more special than Banff because so much of the town is carefully preserved with a keen council. It feels historic but also modern.

There's so much history there as a railway town and I hope the fire can be kept away.

descendants.content:
@chad

Definitely more a Jasper guy than Banff (though I did live in Banff for a summer). Between the actual town and park and some family and personal history, it’s one of my favorite places on the planet.

descendants.content: @chad Having spent my life heading out there and up to Marmot I was having nightmares last night about the fire reaching Marmot… 😬

account.note:
Degree in Political Science, career in tech.
Inhabitant of YEG for most of 54 years and the neighbourhood of Westmount for over 20. Had a new house built during the pandemic on the site of our old one. Partner to the amazing @daintychainsaw.
30+ years in virtual communities from late 80’s BBS’s to current social media with stops in Usenet, MMO groups, Discord…

Gamer of all types from boardgames to computer games to console games. See ‪@Igaze‬ for gaming posts.

Edmonton, Alberta

fields.name: Quote
fields.value:
“Evil begins when you begin to treat people as things.” ― Terry Pratchett

"Nae king! Nae quin! Nae laird! Nae master! We willna' be fooled again!" - Nac Mac Feegle

descendants.content: @chad I thought the Sentinel satellites were top of class for recent imagery but the images I have seen so far of Jasper don’t even come close to the images you have shown.
